definitions.definition: events that are of public interest or political importance

examples.text: **world/international affairs**
an expert on **foreign affairs** *(= political events in other countries)*
We are expecting a statement from the **home affairs** *(= political events in your own country)* spokesman.
internal/external affairs
affairs of state

definitions.definition: an event that people are talking about or describing in a particular way

examples.text: The newspapers exaggerated the **whole affair** wildly.
She wanted the celebration to be a simple **family affair**.
Many people have criticized the way the government handled the affair.
The Whitewater affair was the biggest scandal of the decade.
The debate was a pretty disappointing affair.
I ended up disillusioned and bitter about the whole affair.
I knew that the wedding would be a grand affair.
He has tried to play down his involvement in the affair.
She saw the whole affair as a great joke.

phrases: wash your hands of the affair

definitions.definition: a sexual relationship between two people, usually when one or both of them are already in a relationship with somebody else

examples.text: She **was having an affair** with a co-worker.
an **extramarital affair**
It's the story of a secret affair between a married teacher and her teenage student.
They had a passionate affair for six months.
Their affair did not develop into a lasting relationship.
an affair with a married man
a torrid love affair
How long has the affair been going on?

definitions.definition: matters connected with a person’s private business and financial situation

examples.text: She manages the family's **financial affairs**.
I looked after my father's financial affairs.
She wanted to **put her affairs in order** before she died.

definitions.definition: a thing that somebody is responsible for (and that other people should not be interested in)

examples.text: How I spend my money is my affair.
The details of your relationship should be a private affair.
That's no affair of yours.
It's a family affair.

definitions.definition: an object that is unusual or difficult to describe

examples.text: Her hat was an amazing affair with feathers and a huge brim.
This state of affairs can no longer be ignored.

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Old French afaire, from à faire ‘to do’; compare with ado.
